home.tagline: A passionate software developer building clean, scalable backend systems.

about.title: About Me
about.description: I am a final-year Computer Engineering student, graduating in June 2025, specializing in back-end development (Golang, Java), with hands-on experience in microservices, messaging systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ), AWS services, and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes). Focused to writing clean, maintainable code and leveraging data-driven insights to build scalable and reliable solutions while collaborating effectively in cross-functional teams.

items.companyDescription: Prime Modality is a cybersecurity company developing a comprehensive CNAPP solution that combines Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM) and runtime threat detection using eBPF technology. The platform is designed to be both cloud-native and kubernetes-native, identifying misconfigurations, vulnerabilities, and real-time threats across modern cloud infrastructures and delivering actionable insights to customers.
responsibilities: Engineered 10+ RESTful endpoints using Golang to enhance API scalability and maintainability.
Architected and constructed database solutions using PostgreSQL for relational data, including a filtering system for a Security Findings Dashboard with 9 column-based filter options.
Designed and integrated WebSocket connections in Golang following Event-Driven Architecture and Observer Design Pattern principles to enable real-time data streaming on the platform.
Engineered an API with Golang for the open-source data integration platform CloudQuery, enabling storage of 10K+ cloud environment data records in the graph-based database ArangoDB.
Actively used containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, Minikube, and Skaffold to deploy and manage an environment with 6 services, including 2 different databases.

Collaborated with teams to optimize AWS cloud services, including Elastic Container Service (ECS), Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS), Elastic Container Registry (ECR), and Relational Database Service (RDS), ensuring a highly scalable Cloud-Native infrastructure.

items.name: URL Shortener
items.description: A URL shortening service constructed with Java Spring Boot using the MVC architecture while adhering to Clean Code principles, featuring 4 endpoints, configurable short URL domain support and API documentation via Swagger. Integrated MongoDB for storage and incorporated JUnit unit tests to ensure reliability.

items.name: CAPTCHA Verification System
items.description: A secure user verification platform developed using Spring Framework 6.2.3, implementing CAPTCHA generation and validation with RESTful APIs. Utilized Hibernate and PostgreSQL. Built and tested with Maven and JUnit, running on a Jakarta EE-compatible stack. Supports localization with both Turkish and English language options. Strengthened Java Spring Web MVC proficiency through real-world implementation.

items.name: Waste Management Backend
items.description: A scalable backend system built with Go (Fiber) and PostgreSQL, featuring Docker Compose orchestration and deployment to AWS EC2/RDS. Applied CI/CD automation via GitHub Actions targeting the prod branch. Documented using Swagger and includes database versioning via golang-migrate. Designed with future microservices integration in mind.

items.name: Note Taking App
items.description: A user-authenticated note management application crafted with Golang and Fiber, exposing 11 RESTful endpoints. Created collaboratively by a 2-person team and secured with authentication mechanisms. API documentation provided via Swagger.

items.name: ToDo App
items.description: A 9-endpoint task management API formulated with Gin and backed by MongoDB. Supports user authentication and was collaboratively produced with 2-person team. Fully containerized for seamless deployment and documented using Swagger.

items.name: City List and Traffic Codes
items.description: A 6-endpoint REST API leveraging PostgreSQL for structured data storage, enhanced with caching via Redis and message queue processing through RabbitMQ.
